contents:
Helpful links: thekitchn at home kombucha
Ingredients Small batch
1L water 1 tbsp loose leaf organic green tea 1/3 cup sugar 60ml starter tea 100ml store bought unflavoured, plain kombucha (or, 160ml kombucha from previous batch) 1 scoby ### How to
Boil the water, add the sugar to disolve and brew the green tea Let cool completely, and in a large glass jar add the starter tea, kombucha and scoby. Cover with paper towels or dense cloth and secure with rubber band. First fermentation: let the glass jar sit in a shaded, room temperature area for 7-10 days.
title: Kombucha

contents:
from Nora Cooks
Ingredients 150 g (1 1/4 cups) all-purpose flour 150 g (1 cup) yellow cornmeal 25 g (2 tbsp) sugar, or to taste 1 tsp salt 1 tbsp baking powder 310 g (1 1/4 cups) almond milk, unsweetened 75 g (1/3 cup) canola oil, or melted vegan butter ### How to
Preheat oven to 200C and grease a pan In large bowl, combine all dry ingredients and mix to combine Add the wet ingredients, and mix until just combined Pour batter into the greased pan, and tap on counter to remove air bubbles Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean
title: Cornbread

contents: Ingredients 0.5 c split, hulled mung beans, soaked overnight 1 tbsp agar agar 2 tbsp sugar 2 c water 3 drops pandan flavouring green food colouring (optional) 1 can red kidney beans, rinsed well and drained 1 can high quality coconut milk 2 tbsp sugar 0.5 c sugar 0.5 c water How to Soak the mung beans overnight. Alternatively, soak 1 hour in warm water before using. Rinse and drain the next day Either steam the mung beans for 20 minutes over medium heat, or softly boil in 1.5 cups of water for 20 minutes until they are very soft. You can mash part or all of them, if you want For the pandan jelly, in a pot over medium heat combine agar agar, sugar, water. Stir until the agar agar has dissolved. Stir in the pandan flavour and food colouring. Pour into a glass container and let cool in the fridge for 2 hours. When set, cut into jelly strips 4.For the coconut milk, combine the coconut with sugar and stir until dissolved For the sugar syrup, in a small pot over medium heat, combine the sugar and water until dissolved To assemble, in a tall glass ad 2-3 tbsp of shaved ice, 2 tbsp kidney beans, 2 tbsp mung beans, a layer of pandan jelly, more shaved ice, 3 tbsp of sugar syrup, and 3 tbsp of coconut milk (or more)
title: Vietnamese Three Color (che ba mau)

contents: Ingredients 1 pack of firm tofu, rinsed and drained; or, 220 g of dehydrated soy curls, rehydrated with mushroom broth 1 tbsp of mushroom broth powder, or the water from rehydrated mushrooms 1 slice of ginger, finely chopped (optional) 1 onion, diced 6 tbsp sugar 0.25 c vegan fish sauce (eg. nuoc mam, or soy sauce) 4 garlic cloves, chopped 0.25 c vegetable oil 4 tsp dark soy sauce 0.5 tsp black pepper How to Mix the mushroom broth, ginger, onion, sugar, fish sauce, garlic, oil and dark soy sauce together in a dish Crumble the tofu into the sauce, and let sit for at least 30 mins on the counter or in the fridge overnight In a large pan on medium heat, preheat oil and fry the tofu for 7-8 minutes with the lid on. Remove the lid, stir, replace the lid and cook again for 5 minutes. Repeat until evenly brown
title: Vietnamese Marinated Soy

contents: Ingredients 1-2 cloves chopped garlic 2 tsp chili flakes, or fresh chili 0.5 tsp salt 2 tbsp maple syrup 1 tbsp lime juice 125 (0.5 c) hot water How to Mix all ingredients in a bowl, until sugar and salt have disolved
title: Nuoc Mam

contents: Ingredients circa 20 rice paper sheets handleful of dehydrated, sliced black mushrooms (woodear), rehydrated 1 onion 100 g soy sprouts 1 carrot 1 serving of vermicelli noodles (optional) half pack (smoked) tofu (optional) handful fresh coriander 4 garlic cloves 2 cl vegan nuoc mam 2 pinches of salt 20 g of sugar 1 L oil for frying How to Prep all the vegetables and herbs, so they are all finely chopped and can form a paste: chop the soy sprouts in half, finely dice the onion and garlic, grate the carrot, thinly slice the rehydrated mushrooms, chop the coriander Soak (or cook) the vermicelli noodles, and chop them into 5cm long strips using scissors Mix all the ingredients together in a large bowl, adding the nuoc mam, salt and sugar Boil a kettle of water and add it to a bowl with some cold water, so that it is hot but not scorching. Wet two clean tea towels and wring them out. Lay them on the counter, this is where you will lay the wet rice paper rolls Wet a rice paper roll, lay it on the first towel, add the mixture, and roll it up. Lay the roll on the other wet towel, and repeat Heat the oil in a frying pan. When hot (test with a clean piece of rice paper), add the rolls. You can fry multiple at a time, as long as they don’t touch. Fry until they are golden, then remove and dry on a metal grid or sieve. Don’t use paper towels, it will stick!
title: Vietnamese Spring Rolls (nems)

contents:
Ingredients: 2 aubergines, diced 2 onions, diced 4 garlic cloves, minced 1 green chili 2 tsp cumin 1 tsp ground coriander 2 tsp turmeric 1 tsp brown mustard seeds, optional 2 cans of chopped tomato 2-3 green bell peppers, peeled and diced 1 tsp sugar 1-2 tsp tamarind paste 1 can fava beans, or chickpeas 600 grams fresh tomatoes, chopped in 8 fresh mint #### How to:
Heat oven to 190C. Dice the aubergines, spread them on a baking sheet and drizzle them with oil. Roast for 20-30 mins on 190C In a large sauce pan, fry the onion, garlic and chili on medium heat for 10 minutes Add the spices, fry for 5 minutes Add the chopped tomates, simmer for 5-10 minutes Add the bell peppers, sugar, tamarind, and roasted aubergines. Simmer on low heat Add the beans, and fresh tomatoes. Simmer for 15 minutes, or until cooked Serve with fresh mint
title: Ragou Egyptien aux Aubergines et Tamarind

contents:
Ingredients: 1kg of fruit for 1 tsp agar-agar 1 small lemon for 1kg of fruit 2/3 the weight of fruit in sugar, if keeping the jam out of the fridge dessicated coconut, best if fresh or frozen #### How to:
With vite-pris:
Simmer fruits and lemon juice, adding water if there isn’t enough liquid to cook properly, for 15 minutes Add the vite-pris, simmer for 6 minutes Add sugar Simmer on medium-high heat, until temp reaches 105C and the consistency looks good With gelling sugar:
Simmer fruits, lemon juice and sugar Simmer on medium-high heat, until temp reaches 105C and the consistency looks good With agar-agar:
Simmer fruits, lemon juice and sugar Dilute the agar-agar, with a ratio of 1kg fruit to 1/2 tsp agar-gar
title: Butternut and Coconut Jam

contents:
From Miss Cupcakes
Ingredients 250g flour 150g sugar (as in original recipe, definitely use less!!) 2.5 tsp baking powder 0.5 tsp baking soda pinch salt 220ml mylk 120ml flavourless oil 1 tsp vanilla, or butter vanilla ### How to
Sift dry ingredients together Fold in wet ingredients, mix until just combined Bake at 180C for 30-35 minutes, until toothpick comes out clean Let cool for 10-15 minutes before handling
title: Basic Vanilla Cake

contents:
From Bérénice Leconte
Ingredients Crème d’Amande 80g vegan butter 50g powdered sugar 100g almond meal pinch of salt 40g apple sauce 2 tbsp cornstarch 10g rhum Pâte Sucrée aux Amandes 200g wheat flour 25g almond meal 40g powdered sugar 1 tsp xantham gum (sub corn starch) 2g fine salt 100g vegan butter, room temp 0.5 tsp almond butter 15g linseed meal + 40g hot water Poires 3 or 4 large pears, eg. Comice 1L water 100g sugar 1 tbsp vanilla extract, or vanilla stick 1-2 sticks cinnamon Nappage (optional) 100g water 100g cane sugar, light How to For the crust: in a bowl, add the flour, almond flour, sugar, xantham gum, salt. Add the butter and almond butter, and mix with a spatula by scraping the dry ingredients with the wet until “sablé”. Whisk together the linseed meal and hot water until viscous, add to the mixture and mix by hand until the dough is homogeneous. Refridgerate 30 minutes before use For the almond creme: in a bowl, mix with a spatula the butter, sugar, almonds, salt. Add the apple sauce, cornstarch, rhum. Mix well and refridgerate for 30 minutes before use For the pears: peel the pears. In a pot, bring water, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon to a boil. Add the pears and poach for 15-20 minutes. Drain and let the pears cool. Slice them in half length wise, remove the core, and slice them thinly width wise Assembly: press the dough into a mold and prick with a fork. Spread the almond creme evenly, and arrange the pear slices. Sprinkle with sliced almonds Bake for 45 minutes at 180C Nappage: bring the water and sugar to a boil, and remove from the heat. When the tarte is baked, spread the nappage with a brush
title: Tarte Bourdaloue

contents:
Ingredients 1 large or 4 small cucumbers 0.5 onion 1 clove garlic 1 small slice of bread 0.25 cups slivered almonds, or 1 tbsp almond butter 1 tbsp olive oil 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar salt, pepper, 1 tbsp oregano 3-4 potatoes ### How to
Blend in a high speed blender, adding water and ice to get desired consistency Thinly slice potatoes and fry them in a pan until crispy. Let them cool Chill in the fridge as long as possible Top with potatoes, chopped cucumber, chopped onion, olive oil…
title: Cold Cucumber Soup

contents:
Ingredients 1 jar of roasted red bell peppers, drained and rinced 1 clove of garlic 1 small slice of bread 1 tbsp almond butter, or a handful slivered almonds salt, pepper, oregano ice cubes optional: balsamic vinegar, olive oil, onion, tomato ### How to
Blend in a high speed blender, adding water and ice to get desired consistency Chill in the fridge for as long as possible Top with basil, olive oil, flowers, dill, black salt…
title: Cold Red Pepper Soup

contents:
### Ingredients
1 quiche dough (optional) 1 onion 4 garlic cloves 1/2 red bell pepper 1/2 tsp herbs like thyme and oregano 200 g spinach 300 g tofu 2 egg replacers 1.5 tsp mustard 0.25 tsp turmeric 1 tbsp nutritional yeast 1 tbsp soy sauce 100 ml soy mylk (skeptical whether this is required) 1.5 tsp corn or tapioca starch 0.5 tsp salt 1 large tomato 0.25 tsp kala namak How to Preheat oven to 180C Finely dice the onion and garlic, and bell pepper 1 cm chunks Add oil to a pan and fry for 8 minutes. Add the herbs and spinach, and fry for another few minutes In a blender, blend the tofu and the rest of the ingredients (except the tomato and kala namak). Mix in the vegetables Roll the quiche dough into a baking dish, and add the tofu and veg mixture Top with sliced tomato, and bake for 45-60 minutes Sprinkle with fresh herbs and kala namak
title: Frittata

title: About

contents:
Makes 12 wontons
Ingredients wonton wrappers, this makes 12 but maybe more 1 tsp ginger, finely chopped 100 g tempeh, tofu, vegan meat ground, or other mock meat, finely chopped 3-4 pak choi leaves, finely chopped 2 green onions, finely chopped 1/2 tsp corn starch, + 1 tbsp water Sauce 2 tbsp fragrant soy sauce 2 tbsp crispi chili oil 2-3 cloves garlic, finely chopped 3 tbsp green onions Fragrant Soy Sauce 100 ml light soy sauce 200 ml water 1/3 cinnamon stick 1/2 star anise 1/4 tsp fennel seeds 1/2 tsp sichuan peppercorns 2 tbsp brown sugar How to Fragrant Soy Sauce In a sauce pan, bring all ingredients except sugar to a boil. Then turn down to a simmer, and simmer for 30 minutes Cut the heat and add the sugar Dumplings Finely chop the ginger, vegan meat substitute, pak choi, green onion and combine them in a small bowl with the corn starch mixture Prepare a bowl of cold water. Take a dumpling wrapper and scoop a spoon of the filling in the center. Dip a finger in the cold water and run it along the edge of half the wrapper, then fold it in half. Shape it in any way you want, such as folding in half and bringing the ends together Prepare the serving bowls with the sauce: add the chili oil and fragrant soy sauce, either all in one or divided in between the bowls Bring a large pot of boiling water to a roaring boil, and add the dumplings. Stir so they don’t stick together. When the water comes to a roaring boil again add a small cup of cold water, wait until it boils again and repeat. On the third boil the wontons should be ready. With a slotted spoon, remove them and put them in the serving bowl(s) Top with freshly chopped garlic and more green onions
title: Wontons

contents:
Adapted from Dessert Person and Ms Cupcakes
Ingredients: Coffee Ribbon 3 tbsp light brown sugar 2 tsp cinnamon 1 tbsp instant coffee granules Cake (16 muffins) 560g flour (4.5 cups) 1 tsp baking bowder 1 tsp baking soda 120 g brown sugar (1/3 cup) 2 tsp cinnamon 80 chopped pecans or walnuts (2/3 cup) 120 ml strong brewed coffee (1/2 cup) 1 tbsp coffee granules 230 ml mylk, or buttermylk (1 cup) 320 ml flavourless oil (1 1/3 cups) 100 ml maple syrup (1/3 cup) 2 tsp vanila extract optional: 1 tsp finely grated ginger, 1/4 tsp cardamom How to: Preheat oven to 180C and oil cake pan or line muffin tin In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, brown sugar, cinnamon, nuts Mix coffee granules into the strong brewed coffee, and combine with mylk, oil, maple syrup, vanilla Add the wet into the dry and quickly mix with a metal spoon, until just combined (10 seconds). Don’t stir too much Spoon half the batter into the muffin cups, one spoon per cup. Sprinkle the coffee ribbon over the batter, and spoon the rest evenly on top. If making a cake, pour half the batter, sprinkle the ribbon, then pour the other half evenly Bake for 20-25 minutes for muffins, and until a knife comes out clean for the cake. Cool on wire rack
title: Coffee Coffee Cake/Muffins

contents:
Makes 12 buns
From Erin Ireland
Ingredients 4 tsp active dry yeast 1 tsp sugar 1 cup warm water 1 cup mylk 2/3 cup white sugar 2/3 cup vegan butter 2 tsp salt 6 cups flour Filling 1/2 vegan butter at room temp 1 cup white sugar 3 tbsp cinnamon 2 tbsp cocoa powder (optional) 1 cup toasted, chopped pecans Pan Sauce 800 mL mylk (coconut, oatly, other mylk with extra fat) 2/3 cup brown sugar 2 tsp cinnamon 1 tsp vanilla extract, optional How to Mix the yeast, sugar, water together and set aside In a sauce pan, combine the mylk, sugars, butter and salt over medium heat until butter is melted. Set aside to cool Add the yeast to the mylk when cool enough so that it won’t kill the yeast In a large bowl, add 3 cups flour and mix in the wet ingredients. Add the remaining 3 cups and mix until mostly incorporated. Then, knead it on a lightly floured surface for 8 minutes until the dough is soft and bouncy Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl and cover with a wet tea towel. Place in a warm place and let rise for 90 minutes. For example, in the oven with the light on or a warm room For the filling: when the dough has risen mix the utter, sugar and cinnamon For the pan sauce: whisk the mylk, sugar, cinnamon and optionally vanilla together and pour it into two greased pans Using a rolling pin, roll out the dough in a rectangle 50x40cm and use your hands to shape it correctly. Spread the filling with a spatula and roll from the short side. Using a sharp knife or floss, cut the log into 12 rolls Place the rolls into the pans with the sauce and cover with cling film. Then either: let rise for 45 minutes in a warm place, or refridgerate overnight and take them out 30 minutes before baking Heat oven to 175%deg;C and bake for 25 minutes, or until bubbly and golden When they come out, loosen the sides with a knife and turn them over onto a serving platter so the bottom is facing up
title: Cinnamon Buns

contents:
From chejorge
Vegan version of 滷肉饭 (lu rou fan), or braised pork
Ingredients: 1 block tempeh (sub vegan meat like mock duck) 4 dried shiitake mushrooms 1.5 cups hot water 2 tsp doubanjian (spicy bean paste - sub other bean paste if you don’t have it) 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 tsp ginger, minced 1 shallot, finely minced (sub onion) 2 dried chilis, minced (sub fresh, deseeded chili) 1 star anise 4 tbsp light soy sauce 2 tbsp dark soy sauce 2 tbsp shaoxing wine (sub mirin) 2 tbsp dark brown sugar 1-2 tbsp corn starch, diluted in the mushroom water (sub potato starch) How to: Soak the shiitake mushrooms in the hot water for 15 minutes Crumble the tempeh into small chunks, or cut the mock meat into bite sized pieces. Mince the shiitake mushrooms In a pan, fry the bean paste for a minute, until fragrant. Add the shallot, garlic, ginger, chilies, and fry for 3 minutes. Add the tempeh, mushrooms, star anise, and fry for 3 minutes Deglaze the pan with the soy sauces, shaoxing wine, sugar, mushroom water with corn starch. You can precombine them for convenience. Cover and braise for 15-20 minutes Serve with rice, green onions and pickled vegetables such as radish
title: Taiwanese Braised Tempeh

contents:
From Sweet Potato Soul
Ingredients: 450 g of white beans 1 onion, finely chopped 3 garlic cloves, finely chopped 2 tsp bouillon (or 1 cube) 1/4 cup ketchup 1/4 cup maple syrup 2 tbsp BBQ sauce, optional 2 tbsp soy sauce 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar 2 tbsp dijon mustard 2 tbsp brown sugar 3 tsp smoked paprika 2 tsp liquid smoke 2 tbsp corn starch diluted in 1 cup of water bay leaf, optional How to: If cooking the beans from scratch, cook them according to the instructions with salt and a bay leaf Preheat oven to 190°C In a pot, heat the oil and fry the onion and garlic until golden Add the bouillon, ketchup, BBQ sauce, maple syrup, soy sauce, ACD, mustard, sugar, paprika, liquid smoke, salt and pepper, beans, and diluted corn starch. Optionally add a bay leaf if you didn’t cook the beans yourself Keep on heat for a few minutes, then transfer to an oven safe dish Bake in the oven for 30 minutes, or until the water has evaporated and the top of the beans hardens slightly
title: Bake Beans

contents:
Ingredients Makes a large cake or muffins
Batter 80 ml neutral oil 150 g (3/4 cups, or less) granulated sugar 150 ml soy milk 60 ml lemon juice zest 2 lemons 1 tsp vanilla extract 180 g (1.5 cups) all-purpose flour 100 g (1 cup) 1 tsp baking powder 3/4 tsp baking soda 1/2 tsp salt 2 tbsp poppy seeds, roughly ground Glaze 50 g (1/2 cup) powdered sugar 3 tsp lemon juice water, to thin if necessary How to Preheat the oven to 180C and brush/dust the cake pan In a large bowl, whisk oil and sugar together, then add milk, lemon juice and zest, vanilla extract In another medium bowl, mix all dry ingredients Pour the dry ingredients into the wet, mix until incorporated but don’t overmix Pour the batter into the cake or muffin tins, bake for about 45 minutes or until knife comes out clean Mix the glaze ingredients together, and wait until cake has completely cooled to glaze
title: Poppy Seed & Lemon Cake

contents:
From ‘An Indian Housewife’s Recipe Book’, by Laxmi Khurana
Ingredients: 2 cans white chana (chickpeas) or 340g dried chickpeas cooking oil ½ tsp cumin seeds (jeera) ½ tsp black mustard seeds (rai) 2 large onions, finely chopped 3 green chillies, finely chopped (optional) 2 tsp tomato purée ½ tsp chilli powder 1½ tsp tandoori masala 1 tsp turmeric powder ½ tsp garlic powder 1½ tsp garam masala juice of half a lemon How to: Heat oil in a pan and fry the cumin and black mustard seeds for 2 minutes, until fragrant Add the chopped onions and chillies if using, and fry until golden Add the tomato puree, chilli powder, tandoori masala, turmeric, garlic powder, garam masala and lemon juice Cook for a few minutes, then add the chickpeas and cook for a few minutes Add water to cover the chickpeas, salt and simmer for ~10 minutes. I’ve also tried this recipe with part chopped tomatoes Optionally take a half cup of chickpeas out and blend them, to make the dhal thicker Serve with basmati rice, fresh tomato slices, coriander
title: Chana Dhal

contents:
From Ottolenghi
Ingredients: serves 4
3 aubergines 120ml olive oil 5 garlic cloves, thinly sliced 1-2 mild dried red chillies 2x400g tins of plum tomatoes 5 large oregano sprigs 1 tsp caster sugar 300g spaghetti 45g vegan parm 20g basil leaves salt and pepper How to: Preheat oven to 220C Peel the aubergine length wise, every other strip. Cut width ways in 1cm thick slices, and put in a bowl with 75ml olive oil, 3/4 tsp salt and pepper. Put on baking sheet and roast for 30-35 minutes, until dark golden-brown In a pan, add oil and sautee garlic and chillies for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the garlic is golden brown Add tomatoes, 1/2 tsp salt, pepper. Reduc heat to medium low and cook for 10 minutes until sauce is thick Remove the oregano sprigs and stir in aubergine In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the spaghetti. Drain and add the sauce, two thirds of the parm and basil. Add cooking water if the sauce is too thick Serve with remaining parm, basil, drizzle of olive oil
title: Pasta alla Norma

contents:
#### Ingredients:
1/2 cup roasted, salted cashews 1 cup vegan butter, softened 1/2 cup sugar zest of 1 organic lemon 1 tsp vanilla extract 2 cups flour sugar for rolling the cookies #### How to:
Preheat oven to 165C In a food processor, blend the cashews until they are crumbly and finely ground In a bowl combine the cashews, butter, sugar, zest, vanilla and flour, and mix until everything is well incorperated If the dough is really soft, refridgerate for 1 hour. Otherise form a ball of dough (about 3cm) and roll it into granulated sugar. Set it on a lined baking sheet and lightly flatten, with your hand or the bottom of a glass Bake at for 17-19 minutes, or when slightly brown on the edges

contents:
From hotforfood
Ingredients: makes 12
2 cups flour 3 tsp ground ginger 2 tsp ground cinnamon 1 tsp ground cloves 1 tsp baking soda 1/2 tsp salt 1/2 C butter, sub coconut oil 1/4 C molasses 1/4 C mylk (soy or oat) 1/2 C brown sugar 1 tsp vanilla extract 1/3 C granulated sugar How to: Preheat oven to 175 C In a large bowl, whish together the wet ingredients Add the dry ingredients and fold together until just combined Take ~2 tbsp of dough, roll it into a bowl and roll it in the granulated sugar. Set it on a tray lined with parchment paper, and lightly press. Don’t put the cookies too close together as they will spread Bake for 15 minutes, one baking sheet at a time. They should come out soft! Remove from baking sheet and cool on wire racks

That’s it!

contents:
Ingredients:
1/4 cup olive oil 2 red onions, finely chopped 2 firm tomatoes, chopped a cinnamon stick a bay leaf How to:
In a saucepan, heat the oil and fry the onions for 5 minutes or until soft Add the tomatoes, cinnamon and bay leaf, and simmer until everything is soft. Stir occasionally Serve hot or cold, on soups like a yellow split pea soup, with bread, and so on
title: Red Onion and Tomato Chutney

contents: Ingredients mylk cream vanilla sugar rice, specifically for pudding water How to In a pot, bring the mylk, sugar and vanilla to a simmer for Rinse the rice well and put it in a small pot with the water, and bring to a boil to parboil it. When it boils, take it off the heat and strain it under cold water Add the rice to the mylk and bring to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes, or until the rice is tender Optionally hide an almond for someone to find, and sprinkle with cinnamon
title: Milk Rice

contents:
Ingredients Serves 4
250 ml soy creme (or oat) 250 ml soy milk (or oat) 3/4 tsp agar-agar 3 tbsp light brown sugar tonka bean, grated, or vanilla bean Coulis 3-5 cups fresh or frozen fruit, such as berries, pomegranate, peaches 2 tbsp sugar, or to taste optionally: cinnamon stick, cardamom, 1 tsp lemon juice How to In a pot, whisk all the ingredients together Bring to a boil for a few minutes, stirring constantly Pour into individual cups, preferably glass, let cool and refridgerate until solidified (2 hours) For the coulis, put the fruit, sugar and any spices in a pot on medium heat, simmer until the fruit is soft. Strain if you want to remove the seeds Serve with the coulis, fresh mint, basil, or anything else fun on hand
title: Panna Cotta

contents: Ingredients: Dry 2 1/4 cup flour 1/3-3/4 cup sugar 1/2 tsp baking soda 1 1/2 tsp baking powder Wet 2 overripe bananas, mashed 1/2 cup soy milk 3/4 cup oil 1 butter vanilla essence, or 1 tbsp vanilla extract 1 tbsp rhum Topping 3/4 cup chopped pecans and/or walnuts 1-2 tbsp sugar 1 tbsp flour 1 tbsp cold vegan butter How to: Mix the wet and dry ingredients together in separate bowls Combine them and fold the batter, and do not overmix so that it doesn’t form a glutinous dough. Use a spatula rather than a whisk Mix the topping ingredients together with your hands Pour the batter in a greased mold, and sprinkle the topping Bake at 180C for 40-50 mins, until a knife comes out clean. Don’t be like me and not check, do check!!
title: Banana Bread

contents:
Ingredients: green beans, 450g shallot, 1 garlic, 2 mushrooms, 1C flour, 5T dry white wine, 3T broth, 1C mylk, 1C soy sauce, 1t salt, pepper, parm Baked Onions: mylk, 1C ACD, 1T onion rings, 1 flour, 1/3C salt, pepper, garlic powder #### How to:
Onions
Combine mylk + ACD Add onions, let sit for 15 minutes Drain the mylk and return the onions to bowl Add flavouring and flour, toss Spray oil over the onions and bake 215C for 25 minutes Beans
Boil green beans for 8 minutes Fry shallot, garlic, mushrooms in a pan Add wine if using Add flour, cook 3 minutes Slowly add broth, mylk, soy sauce and simmer 6 mins Add green beans Put in baking dish and top with onions, and bake 200C for 20 minutes Add parm
title: Green Bean Casserole

contents: Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter 2 medium shallots, diced 1/4 cup flour 2.5 cups veggie broth 1/4 cup red wine 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar 2 sprigs fresh thyme or rosemary salt & pepper How to: Melt the butter and fry the shallots until translucent Add the flour and cook for 30 seconds Slowly add the broth as not to clump the flour, stir constantly Add the wine, vinegar, herbs, salt, pepper, and simmer until the bitter wine taste is cooked off (20 minutes) From Southern Vegan by Lauren Hartmann
title: Red Wine & Shallot Gravy

contents: Ingredients: Mash: 3 sweet potatoes 1/3 cup mylk 1 tbsp brown sugar 1/2 tsp allspice 1/4 tsp vanilla 1/2 tsp salt Crumble: 1/2 cup flour 4 tbsp melted butter 1/2 cup chopped nuts (walnuts, pecans, hazelnuts) 1/4 cup brown sugar 1/2 tsp salt How to: Roast potatoes on 190C for 45 minutes, or until cooked Mash them & mix in rest of mash ingredients Mix all crumble ingredients together Put the mash in a baking dish and sprinkle the crumble over it Bake at 175C for 25mins
title: Sweet Potato Casserole

contents:
Makes enough for 8 people
From BBC goodfood
Ingredients: 2 tsp each coriander and cumin seeds 1 tsp paprika, plus extra for dusting 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon 150ml olive oil 900g squash, peeled and cut into small chunks (about 2cm) 12 shallots, quartered 4cm piece ginger, finely chopped 140g whole blanched almonds 140g shelled pistachios 75g pack dried cranberries 6 tbsp clear honey 225g pack fresh spinach 400g can chickpeas, drained and rinsed 2 garlic cloves 1 tsp ground cumin 3 tbsp lemon juice 4 tbsp chopped fresh coriander 100g vegan butter 8 large sheets of filo pastry lemon wedges to serve Harissa yoghurt:
200g vegan greek yoghurt 6 tbsp mylk 3 large sprigs mint, leaves chopped 2-3 tbsp harissa paste How to: Preheat the oven to 180C
Dry fry the seeds briefly in a small pan over a medium heat until toasty (don’t let them burn!). Grind coarsely using a pestle and mortar (or a bowl and the end of a rolling pin), then mix in the paprika, cinnamon, 1⁄2 tsp salt and 4 tbsp oil. Put the squash into a baking tray or dish, and pour over the spiced oil and toss. Roast for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat 2 tbsp of oil in a frying pan, add the shallots and cook, stirring, until they start to brown. Stir in the ginger and 100g each almonds and pistachios. When brown, toss in the cranberries, 2 tbsp honey, and the spinach so it wilts. Take off the heat and stir into the squash, when it comes out of the oven. Set aside.
In a food processor, mix the chickpeas with the garlic, cumin, remaining oil, lemon juice, 2 tbsp water and salt and pepper to make houmous. Stir in the coriander.
Melt the butter in a small pan. Put a loose-bottomed 28cm quiche tin on a baking sheet and brush with some butter. Keeping the filo covered with a damp cloth so it doesn’t dry out, lay one sheet over half of the tin so that it hangs over the edge by about 10cm. Lay another sheet on the other side, so it overlaps the first in the centre and hangs over the opposite edge. Brush with butter. Lay two more filo sheets in the opposite direction in the same way and brush with more butter.
Build up two more layers in this way, so you use a total of eight sheets of filo. Pile half the squash mixture in the centre of the pastry. Spread over the houmous and then the rest of the squash mixture. One at a time, bring the edge of each filo sheet up to the centre to cover the filling, creating voluptuous folds as you go. Brush carefully with more butter. (If making a day ahead, cover now with cling film and chill. To reheat, remove the pie from the fridge, heat the oven, then bake for 35-40 minutes.)
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until crisp and golden. Just before the pie is ready, reheat any remaining butter in the pan, tip in the rest of the nuts and fry until golden. Spoon in the 4 remaining tbsps of honey and, when it melts, take off the heat and pour over the pie. Serve with Harissa yogurt sauce (mix the yogurt and milk together to make a thin sauce, stir in the herbs and season, swirl in harissa to taste) and lemon wedges.
title: Moroccan Spiced Pie

contents:
From Ilinca
Ingredients: marzipan sour cream (vanilla mylk) 1 butter vanilla essence sugar slivered almonds puff pastry soy milk, for brushing icing sugar, for dusting How to: Blend all ingredients together Roll out the puff pastry and spread the mixture on half of the dough. Fold in half and cut strips Twist them on themselves and form into a pretzel shape, brush with soy milk and sprinkle almonds Bake at 185C for 20 mins or until golden brown Dust with powdered sugar
title: Marzipan Bretzen

contents: Ingredients: Crust: store bought, or flour hazelnut flour butter vanilla salt Filling: 2 cups pumpkin, mashed 2/3 cup soya creme (sub coconut milk or blended cashews) 2.5-3 tbsp cornstarch 1/6 cup maple syrup 1/2 cup brown sugar 1 tbsp rhum 1/2 tsp vanilla 1.5 tsp cinnamon 1 tsp ginger 1/2 tsp all-spice 1/4 tsp cloves 1/4 tsp nutmeg 1/4 tsp salt 1/4 cardamom, optional How to: Make the crust and fit it to a pie mold. Refrigerate while oven preheats to 180C. Fill pie crust with pie weights/beans in baking paper, and blind bake for 20 minutes Take crust out and let cool completely Mix all the filling ingredients together, pour in pie crust and bake for 45 minutes (up to 60, should be a little jiggly in the 1” center, if over baked it’ll crack) Take out and let cool completely. Refrigerate for best texture and take out of fridge ~30 minutes before serving. Other recipes: http://laminesubnuc.ro/2015/10/24/placinta-americana-cu-bostan-vegan/
title: Pumpkin Pie

title: Chocolate Tart

contents: Ingredients: 100g butter, room temperature 80g powdered sugar 1/2 orange zest pinch salt 25g cocoa powder 130g 550 flour 100ml mylk 30g chocolate, for decorating How to: Preheat oven to 170C Whip butter, sugar, salt and zest together until creamy Sift in cocoa and flour Mix, and add mylk. Consistency should be thick Using piping bag, make log shapes on baking sheet, make sure to space out so they have room to spread Bake for 12 minutes, they should still be soft Let cool completely, drizzle with kuverture chocolate
title: Orange & Chocolate Tongues
